tag_narrative: SDG 16: Peace and Justice Strong Institutions
title_narrative: EU Support to Land Release on Targeted Mine Suspected Areas in Bosnia and Herzegovina
sector_narrative: Removal of land mines and explosive remnants of war
description_narrative: Contract related to: EU Support to Land Release on Targeted Mine Suspected Areas in Bosnia and Herzegovina - This action will be implemented in three areas: integrated border management, migration, and demining.The Action is designed to strengthen capacities of competent institutions, which will result in streghthening migration management as well as reduced number of security hazards related to mines and explosive remnants of war. Within the Integrated Border Management, the effectiveness of border surveillance, inter-agency cooperation and capacity management should be improved.Clearance in the selected affected mine suspected areas, targeted by this Action, will improve the safety of the population in the benefiting municipalities, as it will significantly reduce the mine threat potential of incidents and accidents. It will improve the living conditions of the local communities by making available currently blocked natural and infrastructure resources at the municipality scale.

result_description_narrative: Project results will contribute to overall personal safety in Bosnia and Herzegovina and in particular in the project targeted communities and municipalities. The project would contribute to decrease of  the amount of mine suspected land in Bosnia and Herzegovina, and would enhance the socioeconomic and development precoditions for the residents of Brod, Kotor Varo, Tesli, Doboj, Brod, Kupres (RS), Ribnik, Banja Luka, ajnie, Kalinovik, Berkovii, Rudo, Rogatica, Han Pijesak, Vlasenica, ekovii, Osmaci, Nevesinje, Milii, Viegrad, Pale. spond to both violence against women and violence against children, including building an understanding of when and how interventions to prevent or respond to both violence against women and violence against children work, and when coordinated or integrated violence against children and violence against women interventions are not recommended (and why).
